newsitem.title: NETHERLANDS: OPTIONS --Uncertainty on rates creates demand puts.
newsitem.headline: OPTIONS --Uncertainty on rates creates demand puts.

text.p: The share index once again led trade on the European Options Exchange on Wednesday and dealers said premiums for puts were becoming expensive.

"The share market index is slipping today as the market is getting nervous ahead of Thursday's Bundesbank meeting," said one dealer, adding participants were quickly stepping into put contracts for the AEX index.
"If the Bundesbank does not trim the repo rate, the share market could dip by some 10 points," the dealer said.
EOE option contracts counted for nearly a quarter of the total turnover, with trade in puts outnumbering trades in calls by about two to one.
The premium of the most active EOE put contracts, the September 530 strike and the September 540 strike, rose respectively to 1.80 guilders from 1.50 and to 3.00 from 2.10 in late afternoon.
